title: Foot fetishist who offered teen £40 and four cans of Dragon Soop for sex act jailed
text:

A foot fetishist who offered an "extremely vulnerable" teenager cash and four cans of Dragon Soop to perform a sex act on him has been jailed for 18 months.

Philip McDonnell, 51, contacted the 16-year-old girl by text message and continually referred to his ‘foot fetish’ in April and May this year.

McDonnell also asked her and her 18-year-old friend to travel to Newcastle to perform sex acts on each other.

He continued to pester the teenager and asked her to be his girlfriend, Glasgow Sheriff Court heard.

McDonnell pleaded guilty last month to acting in a threatening and abusive manner towards the two teens.

McDonnell was jailed today by Sheriff Alan Mackenzie and put on the sex offenders register for 10 years.

The court heard McDonnell contacted the 16-year-old, who cannot be named for legal reasons, who was described as “extremely vulnerable."

McDonnell inquired about a ‘deal’ between the two. Prosecutor Lori Pidegon said: “When she asked what it was, she was told that it was a foot fetish. He offered her £40 and four cans of Dragon Soop."

The teen refused to perform a sex act on him, but he continued to bombard her with sex messages in which he mentioned spanking her.

(Image: Daily Record)

McDonnell then asked if the girl and her friend would travel to Newcastle to “perform sex acts” on each other.

The police were contacted and McDonnell was arrested.

McDonnell also sent sex messages to the 18-year-old.

Miss Pidgeon added: “He kept offering money and alcohol in return for performing sex acts.

“The accused also made reference to smacking her bottom and asking how she was punished as a child.”

The teenager was also asked if she wanted to be in a relationship with him.
description: Philip McDonnell, 51, tried to tempt the 16-year-old with cash and the alcoholic energy drink in Glasgow, Scotland, in May
